snippet: A survey by the Pew Research Center suggests the European Union may struggle to take the steps needed to make it viable over the long term.
abstract: Annual survey by Pew Research Center finds that with European Union sapped by the euro crisis, confidence in the institution and the benefits it was supposed to provide is flagging faster and further than ever before; results show deepening disillusionment with union in major countries.

byline.contributor: Reporting was contributed by Nicola Clark and David Jolly from Paris, Jack Ewing from Frankfurt, Julia Werdigier from London, Elisabetta Povoledo from Milan and Raphael Minder from Madrid.

lead_paragraph: A survey by the Pew Research Center suggests the European Union may struggle to take the steps needed to make it viable over the long term.

headline.seo: Poll Shows European Union Loses Favor on Continent
headline.main: Grind of Euro Crisis Wears Down Support for Union, Poll Finds
headline.print_headline: Grind of Euro Crisis Wears Down Support for Union, Poll Finds
